text:
We cannot label components as they may be different across CanICA runs.

Showing the output before the code is not illogic : we show the figures before the code, which is part of the output of the script. However, I agree that such a long output should not be shown. We should first reduce the verbosity of the objects. Second, I think that these debug output are done on stderr, not on stdout. We should not capture stdout, but it has to be verified.

text: If I am not mistaken, these lines are actually useful: if you change an example, it forces sphinx to re-run it. Ideally, there should be a test of files modification date (if the script is newer than the image, re-run it, otherwise keep the already computed image). Have you tested that these lines are superfluous ?

text: I found the behavior of the tooltip annoying in a particular situation: if you go on a figure, make the tooltip appear and then go right to hover the next figure (trhough the tooltip) I would like the tooltip to disappear. No other comment on the rendering: it's far more better than the previous one.
title: nan

text:
Even if it works, I really doubt that adding a `tooltip` field to a `div` is standard. I think that HTML 5 introduce a way to store custom data (throught the data-\* fileds) but otherwise, this may cause trouble. Hace you tried it on older browsers ?

At least, renaming it `data-tooltip` has to be done, so we are HTML 5 compliant. At best, I think that we could use an existing unused tag like `title`.

The reference doc says:
"confounds: list of confounds, optional :

So is it already solved or should the ordering be pointed out specifically?

text:
I had to remove dataset fetcher tests because the new API break them. I can make new smoke tests (that will increase code coverage) but it won't be useful... The only way to test the dataset fetchers in real conditions is to create phony dataset files (ie files that mimic the dataset tree) locally, as it has already been done for haxby simple.

@GaelVaroquaux do we make smoke tests, tests with phony files or no test at all ?
